alarm.name: snapshot backup success
alarm.title: snapshot backup success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create snapshot backup successfully which is from node of (#2) to node with ip of (#3), the first snapshot is (#4), the second is (#5),destination is (#6), see the progress at task manager.

alarm.name: snapshot backup fail
alarm.title: snapshot backup fail
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create snapshot backup fail which is from node of (#2) to node with ip of (#3), the first snapshot is (#4), the second is (#5),destination is (#6).
alarm.suggest: check if the snapshot exists, non-incremental snapshot backup need non-existence of distination. ensure that when incremental snapshot backcup, the distination has already the first source snapshot and the second one must be later than the first source snapshot and the lastest snapshot of distination is the very first source snapshot

alarm.name: delete task success
alarm.title: delete task success

alarm.name: delete task fail

alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) delete the task with id of (#2) unsuccessfully

alarm.name: snapshot clone success
alarm.title: snapshot clone success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create snapshot clone at node of (#2) successfully, the source snapshot is (#3), the distination is (#4).

alarm.name: snapshot clone fail
alarm.title: snapshot clone fail
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create snapshot clone at node of (#2) fail, the source snapshot is (#3), the distination is (#4).
alarm.suggest: check if the source snapshot and the distination are in the same pool

alarm.name: create lun duallive success
alarm.title: create lun(#5) duallive success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create lun duallive successfully which is from node of (#3) to that of (#4), the application mode is (#2)(0:sync 1:async), the master node is (#3) and the slave is (#4), the lun is (#5), the two sides's network interface is (#6), ip of (#7) and netmask of (#9) are binded to the master interface, the slave interface is binded with ip of (#8) and netmask of (#10), if syncing once when established or not (#11)?(0:no 1:yes).

alarm.name: create lun duallive fail
alarm.title: create lun(#5) duallive fail
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create lun duallive unsuccessfully which is from node of (#3) to that of (#4), the application mode is (#2)(0:sync 1:async), the master node is (#3) and the slave is (#4), the lun is (#5), the two sides's network interface is (#6), ip of (#7) and netmask of (#9) are binded to the master interface, the slave interface is binded with ip of (#8) and netmask of (#10), if syncing once when established or not (#11)?(0:no 1:yes).
alarm.suggest: ensure that the size and LU of the two luns are the same, if not, check if those luns were created in a cluster. suggest strongly that the network interface provided for duallive use the different network segment from igb0 interface

alarm.name: delete lun duallive success
alarm.title: delete lun(#3) duallive success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) delete lun of (#3) duallive on node of (#2) successfully.

alarm.name: delete lun duallive fail
alarm.title: delete lun(#3) duallive success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) delete lun of (#3) duallive on node of (#2) unsuccessfully
alarm.suggest: check if duallive of the lun exists on the assigned node, ensure that the assigned node is the master one of this duallive.

alarm.name: create lun backup success
alarm.title: create lun(#5) backup success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1))create lun backup successfully which is from node of (#3) to that of (#4), the application mode is (#2)(0:sync 1:async), the master node is (#3) and the slave is (#4), the master lun is (#5) and the slave one is (#6), the two sides's network interface is (#7), ip of (#8) and netmask of (#10) are binded to the master interface, the slave interface is binded with ip of (#9) and netmask of (#11), if syncing once when established or not (#12)?(0:no 1:yes).

alarm.name: create lun backup fail
alarm.title: create lun(#5) backup fail
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) create lun backup unsuccessfully which is from node of (#3) to that of (#4), the application mode is (#2)(0:sync 1:async), the master node is (#3) and the slave is (#4), the master lun is (#5) and the slave one is (#6), the two sides's network interface is (#7), ip of (#8) and netmask of (#10) are binded to the master interface, the slave interface is binded with ip of (#9) and netmask of (#11), if syncing once when established or not (#12)?(0:no 1:yes).
alarm.suggest: ensure that the size of two luns is the same, suggest strongly using IP with the different network segment from igb0

alarm.name: update lun backup success
alarm.title: update lun(#5) backup success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) update lun backup from node of (#3) to node of (#4) successfully, the master lun is (#5), the slave one is (#6)，operation is (#2)(0:set interval of async mode 1:forward full sync 2:reverse full sync 3:forward update sync 4:reverse update sync) the async interval is set to (#7), except setting interval, others can see progress in task manager.

alarm.name: update lun backup fail
alarm.title: update lun(#5) backup fail
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) update lun backup from node of (#3) to node of (#4) unsuccessfully, the master lun is (#5), the slave one is (#6)，operation is (#2)(0:set interval of async mode 1:forward full sync 2:reverse full sync 3:forward update sync 4:reverse update sync) the async interval is set to (#7).

alarm.name: delete lun backup success

alarm.name: delete lun backup fail
alarm.title: delete lun(#4) backup success
alarm.desc: user (#0)(IP:(#1)) delete the lun backup from lun (#4) at node of (#2) to that of (#5) at node of (#4) fail.
alarm.suggest: 1.know that if /etc/hosts exists the map of two rdc_ip 2.check network health
